entry.title: Microscopy & Microanalysis Cryo-STEM Sunday Short Course

link.title: Microscopy & Microanalysis Cryo-STEM Sunday Short Course

entry.content:
Join us for the M&M Sunday Short Course on Cryogenic STEM for Materials. Details here

X-15 Cryo-STEM and EELS for Materials Sciences

Lead Instructors

Ismail El Baggari
Harvard University

Myung-Geun Han
Brookhaven National Laboratory

Michael Zachman
Oak Ridge National Laboratory

While cryogenic TEM has revolutionized the research in biological science, its applications in materials sciences have been relatively limited. The major challenges lie in realizing reliable cryogenic specimen preparation, and atomic-scale imaging and spectroscopy at a wide range of cryogenic temperatures. Though still in its infancy, recent advancements in cryo-EM, especially in cryo-FIB and new TEM stages, have brought us the promises.

This short course will focus on the fundamentals of cryo-EM and primarily benefit those new to the field. We will highlight historical developments, current state, and future perspectives of cryo-EM for materials science. We will cover critical steps involved in a successful cryogenic microscopy study, including specimen preparation, specimen transfer, cryogenic FIB, new cryo-TEM stages, imaging, spectroscopy at low temperatures, and data analysis methods that can potentially be used to assist cryo-EM data acquisition and data analysis.
entry.summary: Join us for the M&M Sunday Short Course on Cryogenic STEM for Materials. Details here

entry.title: EmJ Rennich and Sarah McDonald join our lab

link.title: EmJ Rennich and Sarah McDonald join our lab

entry.content: EmJ Rennich, a rising senior at the University of Michigan, and Sarah McDonald, a rising sophomore at Harvard, have joined our lab. Both are majoring in Mechanical Engineering. Welcome!
entry.summary: EmJ Rennich, a rising senior at the University of Michigan, and Sarah McDonald, a rising sophomore at Harvard, have joined our lab. Both are majoring in Mechanical Engineering. Welcome!

entry.title: Postdoctoral positions
entry.content: We are hiring! We have postdoctoral positions in in situ cryogenic STEM. See the opportunities tab for more details.
entry.summary: We are hiring! We have postdoctoral positions in in situ cryogenic STEM. See the opportunities tab for more details.

entry.title: Dr. Hesham El Sherif joins the lab

link.title: Dr. Hesham El Sherif joins the lab

entry.content: Hesham has joined our lab. He received his Ph.D from McMaster University where he investigated novel interface materials using electron microscopy. Welcome!
entry.summary: Hesham has joined our lab. He received his Ph.D from McMaster University where he investigated novel interface materials using electron microscopy. Welcome!

entry.title: Patrick joins the lab
entry.content: Patrick is the first member of our lab. He is a junior at Harvard majoring in Math and Physics and will be studying the electrical properties of TEM samples. Welcome!
entry.summary: Patrick is the first member of our lab. He is a junior at Harvard majoring in Math and Physics and will be studying the electrical properties of TEM samples. Welcome!

entry.title: Links to online talks on quantum materials

link.title: Links to online talks on quantum materials

entry.content:
A compilation of recorded colloquia, seminars and schools on quantum materials research.

Summer/winter schools

Princeton Summer School on Condensed Matter Physics, 2020
Fundamental of Quantum Materials Winter School & Workshop, 2018-20XX
Quantum Science Summer School, 2017-20XX
PARADIM Summer Schools, 2016-20XX
EPiQM Summer School at Cornell, 2015-2018
Boulder Summer School, 2013-20XX

Colloquia

General physics talks including ones about condensed matter.

UC Berkeley
Harvard University
University of Chicago
Caltech *change the numbers in the url for other years
ETH Zurich
Fudan University
University of Toronto

Seminars & Conferences

Perimeter Institute *navigate with search interface, by term, speaker, keyword
ICTS Strongly Correlated Systems: from Models to Materials, 2014
KITP: Novel States in Spin-Orbit Coupled Quantum Matter, 2015
KITP: New Phases and Emergent Phenomena in Correlated Materials with Strong Spin-Orbit Coupling, 2015
KITP: Order, Fluctuations, and Strong Correlations, 2017
KITP: Intertwined Order and Fluctuations in Quantum Materials, 2017
KITP: Spintronics Meets Topology in Quantum Materials, 2019
KITP: Correlations in Moire Flat Bands, 2019
Fundamental Physics of Ferroelectrics, 2017-20XX * click year and then “Program & Video” for link
Center for Integrated Quantum Materials
Spin Phenomena Interdisciplinary Center * many great workshops and seminars
entry.summary: A compilation of recorded colloquia, seminars and schools on quantum materials research.
